subject: Sales
title: Gaslighting in Business
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Gaslighting in Business.

hook.text: A vendor denies a promise. You have the email. They say you misread it. Doubt creeps in.

buildup.text: Gaslighting means making someone question their own reality. In business, it's surprisingly common.

discovery.text: Manipulative sellers use it to dodge accountability. 'That's not what I meant' is their refrain.

twist.text: The counter is documentation. Emails, notes, and contracts defeat gaslighting every single time.

climax.text: Ethical sellers own their words. When mistakes happen, they fix them rather than rewrite history.

punchline.text: If someone makes you doubt reality, trust the paper trail.

quiz.question: What is the best defense against business gaslighting?
